title: 112_s1484
content: The Act is titled the "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" and prohibits taxpayer-funded abortions while providing conscience protections in a new chapter added to Title 1 of the United States Code. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits taxpayer-funded abortions and provides conscience protections through various sections such as prohibiting funding for abortions, health benefits plans covering abortion, and limitations on Federal facilities and employees. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits the use of federal funds for abortions and restricts health benefits plans from covering abortion. It also limits abortion services in federal facilities and by federal employees. The text discusses the allowance for separate abortion coverage or health benefits coverage that includes abortion as long as it is paid for with non-Federal funds. It also mentions that non-Federal health benefits coverage providers can offer abortion coverage. The text allows for separate abortion coverage or health benefits coverage including abortion, using non-Federal funds. It also permits non-Federal health benefits coverage providers to offer abortion coverage without affecting other Federal laws. The limitations on abortion coverage do not apply in cases of rape, incest, or when the mother's life is in danger due to a physical condition caused by the pregnancy. The text discusses the application of funds in the District of Columbia and prohibits discrimination against certain health care entities by Federal agencies or programs. The text prohibits discrimination against health care entities that do not provide, pay for, cover, or refer for abortions. It defines a health care entity broadly and allows courts to issue legal or equitable relief for violations. The text prohibits discrimination against health care entities regarding abortions and allows legal action to be taken by health care entities or the Attorney General to address violations. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is responsible for receiving complaints related to this section. The text outlines procedures for receiving and investigating complaints related to violations of the section prohibiting discrimination against health care entities regarding abortions. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is tasked with handling complaints, coordinating with the Attorney General, and referring complaints to appropriate agencies. Prohibiting taxpayer funded abortions and providing conscience protections.
